clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Preoxygenation With Positive Airway Pressure: a Comparison of the Supine and 25째 Head up Position
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Preoxygenation With Positive Airway Pressure in Non-obese Healthy Patient: a Comparison of the Supine and 25째 Head up Position

lead_sponsor.agency: B.P. Koirala Institute of Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: B.P. Koirala Institute of Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: Several techniques such as positive airway pressure and head-up tilt during preoxygenation have shown to prolong non-hypoxic apnea period compared to conventional technique. However, uniform recommendations have not yet been made. Therefore, in the present study the investigators attempted to find out the effect of combination of 5 cmH2O CPAP and 25째 head up position during preoxygenation.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study 60 non-obese healthy adult patients were divided into three groups; Group C receiving preoxygenation in conventional technique, Group S receiving preoxygenation with 5 cmH2O CPAP and Group H receiving preoxygenation in 25째 head-up position with 5 cmH2O CPAP. After 3 min of preoxygenation, anesthesia was induced and trachea intubated. After confirming the tracheal intubation by direct visualization, all patients were left apneic in supine position with the tracheal tube exposed to atmosphere till the SpO2 dropped to 92%. The primary outcome compared between the groups was the non-hypoxic apnoeic period (time to fall SpO2 to 92%).

primary_outcome.measure: non-hypoxic apnoeic period (time to fall SpO2 to 92%)
primary_outcome.description: After 3 min of preoxygenation, anesthesia was induced and trachea intubated. After confirming the tracheal intubation by direct visualization, all patients were left apneic in supine position with the tracheal tube exposed to atmosphere till the SpO2 dropped to 92%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of pH at different time points
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial blood gas analysis was done and the pH at the start of preoxygenation, after preoxygenation and at desaturation (SpO2= 92%) were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of PaO2 at different time points
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial blood gas analysis was done and the PaO2 at the start of preoxygenation, after preoxygenation and at desaturation (SpO2= 92%) were compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of PaCO2 at different time points
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial blood gas analysis was done and the PaCO2 at the start of preoxygenation, after preoxygenation and at desaturation (SpO2= 92%) were compared.

arm_group.description: preoxygenation done with 100% oxygen in supine position
preoxygenation done with 5 cmH2O CPAP (continuous positive airway pressure) in supine position with 100% oxygen
preoxygenation done in 25 degree head-up position with 5 cmH2O CPAP with 100% oxygen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients of ASA physical status I and II undergoing surgery under general anaesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- anticipated difficult mask ventilation/ intubation
- individuals with significant cardiorespiratory or cerebrovascular disease
- pregnant ladies
- patient with history of epilepsy
- body mass index >25 kg/m2
- hemoglobin <8 gm/dL
- patients who were non-ambulant for >24 h, having SpO2 < 97% while breathing in room air
- phobia to facemask.
